1.title: Darting Elk in New Mexico
1.plot: Dr. Ole Alcumbrac and his team need to capture, study and collar 30 adult female elk, before dangerous weather shuts down the operation.

2.title: Desert Bighorn's Wild Ride
2.plot: Two helicopter teams work together; the capture and relocation of 30 desert bighorn sheep in the mountains of Arizona.

3.title: A New Population of Sonoran Pronghorn
3.plot: Sonoran pronghorn need to be captured, processed and released into the wild, to help grow the population of this critically endangered sub-species.

4.title: Back From the Brink of Extinction
4.plot: Mexican gray wolves get darted and collared as researchers work to manage this controversial and endangered animal.

5.title: Tracking Mule Deer in New Mexico
5.plot: Wildlife biologists work with aerial capture teams, to learn more about the annual migration of the mule deer.

imdb.plot outline: On Wild Ops, veterinary medicine meets Delta Force intensity. A crack team of veterinarians, muggers and pilots attempt to capture, study and relocate wild animals. Utilizing helicopters, snowmobiles, ATVs, radio-collars, dart guns, ropes, nets, hobbles and mobile ER units, these wildlife wranglers chase a wide variety of wildlife: deer, moose, elk, wolves, pronghorn, and bighorn sheep, to name a few. Once captured, the Wild Ops team administers necessary medicines and tracking devices to ensure the health of the individual animal and the entire species for generations to come.
imdb.title: Wild Ops
plot: On _Wild Ops_ (qv), veterinary medicine meets Delta Force intensity. A crack team of veterinarians, muggers and pilots attempt to capture, study and relocate wild animals. Once captured, the _Wild Ops_ (qv) team administers necessary medicines and tracking devices to ensure the health of the individual animal and the entire species for generations to come.::Outdoor Channel
